snippet.title: Man shot by police after hostage situation in Grafton
snippet.content:
A man has been shot by police in Grafton. Picture: AAP
Janet Fife-Yeomans
Share
POLICE have shot a knife-wielding man in Grafton, in NSW's north, following what was is believed to be a hostage situation. The man has been flown by helicopter to hospital in a critical condition. An investigation has been established by police to investigate the shooting. The man was allegedly armed with a knife in North St. Officers told him to put down the weapon and tried to use a Taser stun gun on him, but it was unsuccessful. Originally published as
